Sure! Here is a simple Rust program that prints "Hello, world!" to the console:
```
fn main() {
    println!("Hello, world!");
}
```
To compile and run this program, you can use the `rustc` compiler and the `rust` command. For example, to compile and run the program, you can use the following commands:
```
rustc main.rs
rust main.rs
```
This will compile the program and then run it, printing "Hello, world!" to the console.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
